security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown content with code examples. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no environment variable access. The skill provides text-based guidance for Core Web Vitals optimization.

content.value_statement: Poor Core Web Vitals hurt user experience and SEO rankings. This skill provides clear guidelines, code examples, and checklists to achieve optimal LCP, INP, and CLS scores for better user engagement.
actual_capabilities: Provides target thresholds for LCP, INP, and CLS metrics
Offers code examples for image and font optimization
Explains techniques to fix long JavaScript tasks and improve interactivity
Shows how to prevent layout shifts with proper sizing and skeleton loaders
Includes Lighthouse CI configuration and performance budget setup
Delivers quick optimization checklists for each Core Web Vitals metric
limitations: Does not measure or analyze actual website performance data
Cannot directly modify code or configuration files
Does not integrate with CI/CD pipelines or analytics services
Provides guidance only, not automated testing or deployment

best_practices: Always add width, height, and priority props to LCP images to enable browser optimization and preload
Use skeleton loaders or min-height for dynamic content to prevent layout shifts before content loads
Break long JavaScript tasks into chunks under 50ms using async/await and setTimeout yield patterns
anti_patterns: Using unoptimized images without explicit dimensions or priority for above-the-fold content
Executing heavy computations synchronously on the main thread without yielding to event loop
Rendering dynamic content without reserving space, causing layout shifts and CLS penalties

faq.question: What tools measure Core Web Vitals accurately?
faq.answer: Use Google Lighthouse, Chrome DevTools Performance tab, web-vitals JavaScript library, or Google Search Console for real-user data.

faq.question: What are the good thresholds for each metric?
faq.answer: LCP under 2.5s, INP under 200ms, CLS under 0.1. Values above 4s, 500ms, or 0.25 are considered poor.

faq.question: How does this skill integrate with my codebase?
faq.answer: This skill provides guidance and code examples. You apply the recommendations manually to your code using Read, Edit, and Write tools.

faq.question: Does this skill send my data externally?
faq.answer: No. This is a pure documentation skill that only provides text guidance. No data leaves your environment.

faq.question: Why is my INP score worse than FID?
faq.answer: INP replaced FID in 2024 and measures all interactions, not just first input. INP captures the worst latency across all page interactions.

faq.question: How is this different from Lighthouse alone?
faq.answer: Lighthouse measures performance and shows problems. This skill explains why problems occur and provides specific code patterns to fix them.
